com.jdbwc.util

Class Util

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jdbwc.util.Util

  • public final class Util
extends java.lang.Object
    General utility class to assist the JDBWC Driver.
    Version:
    2008-05-29, 2010-04-10, 2010-04-17, 2010-04-28 changed the DataHandler implementation
    Author:
    Tim Gall

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean checkForExceptions(java.lang.String responseBody)
      Look for errors from the server.
      Chuck a wobbly (alias: throw exception) back to the requesting method with a few details about the problem if one [or more] are found.

      NOTE: This release will only throw one exception for the first found (instead of java's usual exception trail) but will include details for all in the message.
      static java.lang.String csvFormat(java.lang.String input) 
      static java.lang.String csvUnFormat(java.lang.String input) 
      static com.ozdevworx.dtype.DataHandler getCaseSafeHandler(int caseType)
      DataHandler Factory method.

      Get a DataHandler object with keys matching the required caseType to satisfy various database engine requirements.

      All DataHandler objects used by this driver come from this method, making the use of different DataHandler implementations very simple.
      static java.lang.String parseResponse(org.apache.http.HttpResponse response)
      Parse the servers http response into a string if no errors are encountered.
      The http reponse is checked for error headers, then checked for exception triggers delivered from the web server.
      Http response errors would only be thrown from here if the files were moved, deleted or made not readable while actively in use.
      static org.apache.http.HttpEntity prepareForWeb(com.ozdevworx.dtype.DataHandler input) 
      static java.lang.String stripTags(java.lang.String input)

    • Method Detail

      • stripTags

        public static java.lang.String stripTags(java.lang.String input)

      • parseResponse

        public static java.lang.String parseResponse(org.apache.http.HttpResponse response)
                                      throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                             java.io.IOException
        Parse the servers http response into a string if no errors are encountered.
        The http reponse is checked for error headers, then checked for exception triggers delivered from the web server.
        Http response errors would only be thrown from here if the files were moved, deleted or made not readable while actively in use.
        Parameters:
        response - The http response from the web server
        Returns:
        The response from the web server as a String if no errors are encountered.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the results include an error trigger from the web server
        java.io.IOException - if errors are encountered converting the http entity to a string

      • checkForExceptions

        public static boolean checkForExceptions(java.lang.String responseBody)
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Look for errors from the server.
        Chuck a wobbly (alias: throw exception) back to the requesting method with a few details about the problem if one [or more] are found.

        NOTE: This release will only throw one exception for the first found (instead of java's usual exception trail) but will include details for all in the message.
        Parameters:
        responseBody - The Server response String.
        Returns:
        false if no errors are found.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if any errors are detected.

      • prepareForWeb

        public static org.apache.http.HttpEntity prepareForWeb(com.ozdevworx.dtype.DataHandler input)
        Parameters:
        input - DataHandler
        Returns:
        A UrlEncodedFormEntity of NameValuePair's representing the input param

      • getCaseSafeHandler

        public static com.ozdevworx.dtype.DataHandler getCaseSafeHandler(int caseType)
        DataHandler Factory method.

        Get a DataHandler object with keys matching the required caseType to satisfy various database engine requirements.

        All DataHandler objects used by this driver come from this method, making the use of different DataHandler implementations very simple.
        Parameters:
        caseType - One of Util.CASE_LOWER, Util.CASE_UPPER, Util.CASE_MIXED
        Returns:
        A new DataHandler object with keys forced to caseType

      • csvFormat

        public static java.lang.String csvFormat(java.lang.String input)

        public static java.lang.String csvUnFormat(java.lang.String input)
